summary: The concept of "party organisation" refers to the structured framework through which political parties operate within the European Union. As a redirect to the preferred term "party organisation," it encompasses the legal and regulatory mechanisms that govern the formation, functioning, and financing of political parties. These organisations play a pivotal role in the democratic process, influencing policy-making and representation at both national and EU levels. The regulatory context includes compliance with EU directives on transparency, accountability, and electoral integrity, ensuring that party organisations uphold democratic values and contribute to the political landscape effectively.
